# Data Structures
## Vectors
### Exercise 1.1
```{r}
typeof(mtcars)

class(mtcars)

nrow(mtcars)
# Returns the number of rows in the data frame

ncol(mtcars)
# Returns the number of columns in the data frame

length(mtcars)
# Returns the length of the data frame (which is equivalent to the number of columns)

dim(mtcars)
# Returns the dimensions (width and length) of the data frame (or number of rows and number of columns)

rownames(mtcars)
# Returns the name of each row

colnames(mtcars)
# Returns the name of each column

```

### Exercise 1.2
```{r}
T <- 123
TRUE <- 123
# This returns an error because 'TRUE' is a vector while T is a value
```

### Exercise 1.3
```{r}
lgl <- c(TRUE, FALSE, NA)
int <- c(1L, 6L, NA, 10L)
dbl <- c(1, NA, 2.5, 4.5)
chr <- c(NA, "these are", "some strings")

str(c(TRUE, "chr")) 

c(1, FALSE)
# num [1:2] 1 0
str(c(1, FALSE))

c("a", 1)
# chr[1:2] "a" "1"
str(c("a", 1))

c(TRUE, 1L)
# int [1:2] 1 1
str(c(TRUE, 1L))
```

### Exercise 1.4
```{r}
as.integer(FALSE)
# 0

as.integer(TRUE)
# 1
```

### Exercise 1.5
```{r}
x <- sample(c(TRUE, FALSE), size = 75, replace = TRUE)
str(x)

(sum(x))
# 33

mean(x)
# .44

mean(x) == sum(x) / length 
# TRUE
```
